Macaws

Illiger's Macaw

A popular mini-macaw, the Illiger's is predominantly green with a red forehead, and blue on the head and wings. They have a distinctive orange-red patch on their belly.

Origin
Central & South America
Size
15-17 inches (38-43 cm). Weight: 250-300g (8.8-10.5 oz)
Weight
275g avg.
Noise Level
Moderate to Loud. While not as loud as a large macaw, they have a high-pitched call that can be quite piercing and frequent.

Looking for a Illiger's Macaw?

See Available Illiger's Macaw Listings

Species Ratings

Talking Ability 7/10
Noise Level 7/10
Social Needs 6/10
Cuddliness 9/10

Temperament & Personality

Highly intelligent, outgoing, and curious. They are known for their playful and affectionate nature, but they can also be mischievous and require consistent training.

Vocalization & Talking Ability

Good talkers for their size. They can learn a variety of words and phrases and are known for their playful chatter.

Dietary Needs

A balanced diet of pellets, fresh fruits, and vegetables. They enjoy nuts as treats, but these should be given in moderation.

Health & Lifespan

Generally a hardy species with a lifespan of 40-50 years. They can be prone to feather plucking if they become bored, so a variety of enriching toys is essential.

Housing Requirements

Needs a large cage for a mini-macaw, at least 30"W x 24"D x 48"H. Their noise level might be too much for some apartments.

Common Questions About Illiger's Macaw

What is the lifespan of a Illiger's Macaw?

The Illiger's Macaw typically lives for 40-50 years. With proper care, diet, and regular vet check-ups, they can live a full and healthy life.

Is the Illiger's Macaw good for beginners?

This species is rated as 'intermediate' care level. They require specific attention, socialization, or dietary needs that may challenge first-time owners.

Where does the Illiger's Macaw come from?

The Illiger's Macaw is native to Central & South America.

More Macaws

Blue and Gold Macaw

Very Loud. Their vocalizations are powerful and can be heard from long distances. They are prone to loud screaming, especially in the morning and evening.

Blue-Headed Macaw

Moderate. Their call is higher-pitched and less grating than large macaws, making them a quieter option, though they can still be noisy.

Blue-Throated Macaw

Loud. They have a loud macaw call, but it's generally considered to be less harsh and frequent than that of a Blue and Gold or Scarlet Macaw.
